DataType

Class IntervalNumber

  • java.lang.Object
    • DataType.DataEntry
      • DataType.IntervalNumber
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<DataType.DataEntry>

    public class IntervalNumber
extends DataType.DataEntry
    Author:
    Rodolfo Lourenzutti Date 06/07/2014 This class represents an interval number and inherits from the DataEntry class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IntervalNumber()
      A default constructor that creates the interval number [0,1].
      IntervalNumber(double xInf, double xSup)
      A constructor that receive two arguments and create an interval object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IntervalNumber

        public IntervalNumber(double xInf,
                      double xSup)
        A constructor that receive two arguments and create an interval object. Obviously, the xInf paramenter must be less equal than xSup.
        Parameters:
        xInf - The inf value of the interval. It must be less equal than xSup.
        xSup - The sup value of the interval. It must be greater equal than xInf.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when xInf is not less equal than xSup.

      • IntervalNumber

        public IntervalNumber()
        A default constructor that creates the interval number [0,1].

    • Method Detail

      • SetBothInfSup

        public void SetBothInfSup(double xInf,
                          double xSup)
        A method that set both parameters of the interval. It checks for the validity of the values.
        Parameters:
        xInf - The inf value of the interval. It must be less equal than xSup.
        xSup - The sup value of the interval. It must be greater equal than xInf.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when xInf is not less equal than xSup.

      • DegreeOfPreferenceInterval

        public double DegreeOfPreferenceInterval(DataType.DataEntry other)
        Calculates the degree of preference of an interval number over another interval number according to Wang, Yang and Xu (2005) - Fuzzy Sets and Systems - 152 - 475-498.
        Parameters:
        other - An interval number to be compared with the caller.
        Returns:
        The degree of preference of the caller object (interval number) and the object.

      • MidPoint

        public double MidPoint()
        Calculates the mid point of the caller interval number.
        Returns:
        The mid point of the interval.

      • Distance

        public double Distance(DataType.DataEntry other)
        dist.
        Specified by:
        Distance in class DataType.DataEntry
        Parameters:
        other - A object that the distance must be calculated from.
        Returns:
        The distance between the object that calls the method and the object in the argument.

      • DistanceL1

        public static double DistanceL1(IntervalNumber a,
                                IntervalNumber b)
        Calculates the L1(modular)-distances between two interval numbers.
        Parameters:
        a - An IntervalNumber object.
        b - An IntervalNumber object.
        Returns:
        The L1-distance between IntervalNumber a and IntervalNumber b.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown when one of the parameters is not an IntervalNumber object.

      • DistanceL2

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(DataType.DataEntry other)
        Compare the mid point of two interval numbers to determine which one is higher.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<DataType.DataEntry>
        Specified by:
        compareTo in class DataType.DataEntry
        Parameters:
        other - An IntervalNumber object.
        Returns:
        Returns 1 if the caller interval number mid point is bigger than the parameter other interval number mid point. Returns 0 if the mid points are equal and returns -1 otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns the string [inf, sup]
